<title level="1" pfs="">[Canopy Elder](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1410)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

In the densest and oldest jungles, arboreals can reach heights of 200 feet or more. Given thousands of undisturbed years, these massive creatures enter into a symbiotic relationship with a myriad of plants, fungi, and animals to achieve the esteemed status of canopy elder. They provide a safe home for the creatures they host and develop a variety of powers that help them defend their forest realms.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Plant](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10)): DC 44

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 42

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 39
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Arboreal_CanopyElder.png" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 19">[Canopy Elder](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1410)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="N" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Gargantuan" />
<trait label="Plant" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=125" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #168: King of the Mountain](/Sources.aspx?ID=87) pg. 78</row>

**Perception** +32; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=23), [tremorsense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=40) (imprecise) 120 feet

**Languages**
[Arboreal](/Languages.aspx?ID=26), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Sylvan](/Languages.aspx?ID=10); [_speak with animals_](/Spells.aspx?ID=293), [_speak with plants_](/Spells.aspx?ID=294)

**Skills**
[Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +37, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) +35, [Forest Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) +35, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +35, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10) +40, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +31

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +10

**Dex** +4

**Con** +9

**Int** +6

**Wis** +8

**Cha** +5
</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 42 

**Fort** +36 

**Ref** +28 

**Will** +33 

</row>

**HP** 445

**Resistances**
bludgeoning 15, piercing 15

**Weaknesses**
[axe](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=1) vulnerability 15, fire 15

**[Attack of Opportunity](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=3)** <actions string="Reaction" /> 

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 40 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
branch +37 ([reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 4d12+18 bludgeoning and [Improved Push](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=29) 20 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
root +37 ([reach 30 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 4d8+18 bludgeoning plus [Trip](/Traits.aspx?ID=196)

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
vine +37 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [reach 40 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 4d6+18 bludgeoning plus [Improved Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=27)

**Primal Innate Spells** DC 38
- **9th**
[Nature's Enmity](/Spells.aspx?ID=205) (×4)
- **Constant (9th)**
[Speak with Animals](/Spells.aspx?ID=293), [Speak with Plants](/Spells.aspx?ID=294)

**Fungal Web** <actions string="Single Action" />  The canopy elder launches a rapidly growing net of fungus from the mushrooms growing on its body at a single creature within 80 feet. The target must attempt a DC 39 Reflex save or become [restrained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=33) by the fungal web ([Escape](/Actions.aspx?ID=79) DC 39). While restrained, the creature takes 4d6 poison damage at the end of each of their turns.

**Pollen Cloud** <actions string="Two Actions" />  The canopy elder releases a dense cloud of pollen from the epiphytes living in its branches. The cloud emanates from the canopy elder in a 40-foot emanation. The cloud doesn't move with the canopy elder and remains in place for 1d6 rounds before dissipating. Creatures inside the cloud become [concealed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=4), and all creatures outside the cloud become concealed to creatures within it. Non-[plant](/Traits.aspx?ID=125) and non-[fungus](/Traits.aspx?ID=77) creatures within the cloud must attempt a DC 38 Fortitude save. On a failure, the creature is [sickened 3](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34), and on a critical failure the creature is also [blinded](/Conditions.aspx?ID=1) for 1 minute. Regardless of the result, a creature is then temporarily immune to the sickening and blinding effects of the canopy elder's pollen for 24 hours.

**Vine Splint** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Healing](/Traits.aspx?ID=89)) The canopy elder grows a mesh of vines around its broken branches, repairing the damage and restoring 40 HP to itself. The canopy elder can't use Vine Splint again for 1d4 rounds.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_4_RelatedCreatures.png">Canopy Elder Allies</title>

Epiphytes, hallucinogenic mushrooms, carnivorous orchids, and stinging insects all call a canopy elder home, as might larger creatures such as primates, big cats, birds, bats, and snakes. Many of these residents will take great pains to defend their home from threats.
</aside>

<document level="2" id="creature-family-8" />
